tags.name: Decision Controller
tags.description: It can be used to obtain an authorization/preauthorization decision/s for one resource.

tags.name: Sessions Controller
tags.description: It can be used to initiate user authentication.

tags.name: Profiles Controller
tags.description: It can be used to obtain information about authenticated profiles found in the Adobe Pass Authentication services for the respective device and application.

tags.name: Configuration Controller
tags.description: It can be used to retrieve the configuration associated with a particular Service Provider.

tags.name: Logout Controller
tags.description: It deletes the authenticated profiles found in the backend for the specific device, client application and specified MVPD.

tags.name: Partner SSO Controller
tags.description: It can be used to handle partner authentication.

parameters.name: code
parameters.description: The registration code obtained after starting authentication on the primary device

parameters.name: serviceProvider
parameters.description: The internal unique identifier associated with a Service Provider during on-boarding process.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: The media type accepted by the client application. If specified it must always be application/json.

parameters.name: User-Agent
parameters.description: The user agent of the client application.

302.description: Redirect. The response contains a location redirect to continue the flow until reaching the MVPD login page.

400.description: Bad request. The request was invalid. Check the JSON-based error information provided in the response body.

401.description: Unauthorized. The access token is not valid, the client application needs to obtain a new one using the information from dynamic client registration process.

404.description: Not found. There is no authentication session found on Adobe Primetime Authentication backend.

405.description: Method not allowed.The client tried to use an HTTP methods that the specified resource doesn't allow.

500.description: Internal Server Error. Something is broken on Adobe Primetime Authentication services side. The JSON-based error information provided in the response body will explain further.

get.summary: Retrieve configuration for specific service provider
get.description: The Configuration API can be used to retrieve the configuration associated with a particular Service Provider.

parameters.name: profile
parameters.description: Provide profile id

parameters.name: serviceProvider
parameters.description: The internal unique identifier associated with a Service Provider during on-boarding process.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: The authorization header containing OAuth2 access token obtained through dynamic client registration process.

parameters.name: AP-Device-Identifier
parameters.description: The application device identifier as described in AP-Device-Identifier.

parameters.name: X-Device-Info
parameters.description: Strongly recommended to use it always when the application's device platform allows to provide valid values explicitly.

parameters.name: X-Forwarded-For
parameters.description: The Streaming Device IP address. Must use it only for Server-to-Server implementations when the call is made by the Programmer Service and not the Streaming Device, while for Client-to-Server implementations, the Streaming Device IP address is implicitly sent.

parameters.name: AP-SDK-Identifier
parameters.description: The SDK identifier as specified in AP-SDK-Identifier. Must use it only by an Adobe Primetime Authentication SDK.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: The media type accepted by the client application. If specified it must always be application/json.

parameters.name: User-Agent
parameters.description: The user agent of the client application.

302.description: Redirect. The response contains a location redirect to continue the flow until reaching the MVPD login page.

400.description: Bad request. The request was invalid. Check the JSON-based error information provided in the response body.

401.description: Unauthorized. The access token is not valid, the client application needs to obtain a new one using the information from dynamic client registration process.

404.description: Not found. There is no authentication session found on Adobe Primetime Authentication backend.

405.description: Method not allowed.The client tried to use an HTTP methods that the specified resource doesn't allow.

500.description: Internal Server Error. Something is broken on Adobe Primetime Authentication services side. The JSON-based error information provided in the response body will explain further.

post.summary: Retrieve authorization decisions using specific MVPD
post.description: In order to perform the preauthorization flow, a valid authenticated profile must be found in the backend for the specified MVPD. If there is no authenticated profile found in the backend for the specified MVPD, then a validation error is returned in the response body, as described in Public APIs - Error codes.

parameters.name: mvpd
parameters.description: The internal unique identifier associated with an Identity Provider during on-boarding process.

parameters.name: resources
parameters.description: A list of resourceIds that identifies the content that might be accessible to a user and is recognized by MVPD authorization endpoints.

parameters.name: serviceProvider
parameters.description: The internal unique identifier associated with a Service Provider during on-boarding process.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: The authorization header containing OAuth2 access token obtained through dynamic client registration process.

parameters.name: AP-Device-Identifier
parameters.description: The application device identifier as described in AP-Device-Identifier.

parameters.name: X-Device-Info
parameters.description: Strongly recommended to use it always when the application's device platform allows to provide valid values explicitly.

parameters.name: X-Forwarded-For
parameters.description: The Streaming Device IP address. Must use it only for Server-to-Server implementations when the call is made by the Programmer Service and not the Streaming Device, while for Client-to-Server implementations, the Streaming Device IP address is implicitly sent.

parameters.name: Adobe-Subject-Token
parameters.description: The Adobe Pass Authentication backend application can also make use of authenticated profiles obtained through Single Sign-On using Platform Identity method

parameters.name: AD-Service-Token
parameters.description: The Adobe Pass Authentication backend application can also make use of authenticated profiles obtained through Single Sign-On using Service Token method

parameters.name: AP-SDK-Identifier
parameters.description: The SDK identifier as specified in AP-SDK-Identifier. Must use it only by an Adobe Primetime Authentication SDK.

parameters.name: AP-Subject-Token
parameters.description: The end-user platform identity as specified in Platform requirements for Adobe SSO.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: The media type accepted by the client application. If specified it must always be application/json.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: The media type accepted by the Adobe Primetime Authentication backend application. If specified it must always be application/json.

parameters.name: AP-Partner-Framework-Status
parameters.description: The Base64-encoded payload containing the partner framework status.

get.summary: Initiate logout for all authenticated profiles of specific MVPD
get.description: The logout service performs the following: deletes the authenticated profiles found in the backend for the specific device, client application and specified MVPD returns a list of actions the client application must perform in order to finalize the logout flow for the authenticated profile with specified MVPD

parameters.name: mvpd
parameters.description: The internal unique identifier associated with an Identity Provider during on-boarding process.

parameters.name: redirectUrl
parameters.description: The final redirect url where the programmer application navigates to when the logout final is completed with the mvpd. This parameter needs to be included when the programmer application initiates the logout flow with the mvpd using the "url" attribute received in OneAPI logout response.

post.summary: Retrieve authenticated profile using partner authentication response
post.description: The partner SSO application sends the mvpd profile information and Pass server saves the profile information in order to use it for decisions calls.

parameters.name: partner
parameters.description: The name of the partner (e.g. Apple) providing the sso framework that is integrated with Pass flows.

parameters.name: SAMLResponse
parameters.description: The Platform SSO profile response containing the needed user metadata for creating a valid authentication token.

post.description: In order to initiate the authentication session from a primary device only a valid serviceProvider parameter value must be provided, while the mvpd, domainName and redirectUrl parameter values may be provided in a later call.

parameters.name: mvpd
parameters.description: The MVPD identifier associated with the end-user's subscription.If device platform has limitations in providing a value, then the application will have to resume the authentication session later on and provide a valid value.

parameters.name: domainName
parameters.description: The originating domain of the application performing mvpd login.

parameters.name: redirectUrl
parameters.description: The url where the client application is redirected to when authentication is completed. The value must be URL encoded.

parameters.name: serviceProvider
parameters.description: The internal unique identifier associated with a Service Provider during on-boarding process.

post.description: This endpoint returns a verification code which is essentially the authentication request. The format should follow the general rules of the OneAPI endpoints so it is a json-formatted body. For degraded integrations, return a json response indicating that the integration is degraded and the next call should be the one in /decisions endpoint.

parameters.description: Strongly recommended to use it always when the application's device platform allows to provide valid values explicitly.

parameters.name: X-Forwarded-For
parameters.description: The Streaming Device IP address. Must use it only for Server-to-Server implementations when the call is made by the Programmer Service and not the Streaming Device, while for Client-to-Server implementations, the Streaming Device IP address is implicitly sent.

parameters.name: Adobe-Subject-Token
parameters.description: The Adobe Pass Authentication backend application can also make use of authenticated profiles obtained through Single Sign-On using Platform Identity method

parameters.name: AD-Service-Token
parameters.description: The Adobe Pass Authentication backend application can also make use of authenticated profiles obtained through Single Sign-On using Service Token method

parameters.name: AP-SDK-Identifier
parameters.description: The SDK identifier as specified in AP-SDK-Identifier. Must use it only by an Adobe Primetime Authentication SDK.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: The media type accepted by the client application. If specified it must always be application/json.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: The media type accepted by the Adobe Primetime Authentication backend application. If specified it must always be application/json.

parameters.name: User-Agent
parameters.description: The user agent of the client application.

302.description: Redirect. The response contains a location redirect to continue the flow until reaching the MVPD login page.

400.description: Bad request. The request was invalid. Check the JSON-based error information provided in the response body.

401.description: Unauthorized. The access token is not valid, the client application needs to obtain a new one using the information from dynamic client registration process.

404.description: Not found. There is no authentication session found on Adobe Primetime Authentication backend.

405.description: Method not allowed.The client tried to use an HTTP methods that the specified resource doesn't allow.

500.description: Internal Server Error. Something is broken on Adobe Primetime Authentication services side. The JSON-based error information provided in the response body will explain further.

authorized.description: The authorization decision for the resource. Can be either true or false.

error.description: If the decision is "false" the error object contains additional information about the Deny decision according to the error information.

mvpd.description: The internal unique identifier associated with an Identity Provider during on-boarding process.

resource.description: The resource identifier for which the authorize decision is returned.

serviceProvider.description: The internal unique identifier associated with a Service Provider during on-boarding process.

source.description: Information about decision source: degradation, temppass, mvpd or dummy.

token.description: Information about media token: issuedAt, notBefore, notAfter and serializedToken.

existing.description: The existing parameters that were already provided.

missing.description: The existing parameters that were already provided.

SessionStatusResponse.description: Response object for session status requests

actionName.description: The action to be performed in a user-agent.

actionType.description: The type of interaction the client application must perform in order to continue the flow with the action specified by the parameter "actionName".

mvpd.description: The internal unique identifier associated with an Identity Provider during on-boarding process.

url.description: The logout URL used to perform logout flow with the MVPD endpoint. It is not present when: actionName=complete or actionName=invalid.

actionName.description: The action that primary device need to perform in order to complete authentication flow.

actionType.description: The type of interaction the client application must perform in order to continue the flow with the action specified by the parameter "actionName".

code.description: The registration code that can be used on the secondary device to continue the authentication flow.

missingParameters.description: The missing parameters that need to be provided in order to complete the authentication flow.

mvpd.description: The id of the identity provider.

serviceProvider.description: The id of the service provider.

sessionId.description: The opaque identifier that can be used for tracking user activity.

url.description: The url where the application needs to navigate.

attributes.description: The list of user metadata attributes. These attributes can be mandatory (userId) or non-mandatory (the rest of the user metadata fields like zip, householdId, maxRating, etc.).

issuer.description: The entity that owns the authenticated profile.

notAfter.description: The maximum timestamp for the authentication profile time-to-live (ttl).

notBefore.description: The minimum timestamp for the authentication profile time-to-live (ttl).

type.description: The type of the authenticated profile.
